result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin M. Winters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Francis Rivard

(Cases called at 10:31- 14CF773, 14CF847, 14CF1046)  All parties for this hearing appear via Zoom video application.
Defendant Benjamin Winters appears in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail.  Attorney Francis Rivard appears.  Deputy District Attorney Peter Rindal appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Revocation packet reviewed by Attorney Rivard and Defendant- no corrections or additions to note on record.  State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defendant waives personal appearance and wishes to proceed via video.  State outlines sentencing recommendation of: 14CF773 Count 1: 3-4 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision; Count 5: 6-9 months in jail; Count 8: 6-9 months in jail; 14CF847- 30 days in jail; 14CF14046: 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  All to run concurrent with each other.  Stipulation at to sentence credit.  Defense requests time served or maximum jail sentences recommended by DOC.  Defendant makes a statement.  
Court orders: 14CF773 Count 1: 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision; Count 5: 6 months jail; Count 8: 6 months jail; 14CF847: 30 days jail; 14CF1046: 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision (all concurrent to each other). Conditions of extended supervision ordered as follows: Comply with any assessments/conditions/programming per agent.  Pay $1,250 in restitution + 10% surcharge.  Defendant eligible for Earned Release and Challenge Incarceration programs.  Credit ordered as follows: 175 days on 14CF773, 63 days on both 14CF847 and 14CF1046.
Revocation Warrant, Order and Packet on Count 1.
